news.title: Under police cover, DDA razes illegal slums in Gokalpuri
news.para: Under police surveillance, approximately 20-25 makeshift dwellings were demolished by afternoon. The operation targeted structures that were constructed on illegally occupied govt land.

news.title: YEIDA to approve key projects to fast-track growth in Greater Noida and Jewar
news.para: At the 85th board meeting held on Wednesday, 54 projects were cleared for implementation over the next 15 years, outlining a comprehensive roadmap for the development of Greater Noida and the entire YEIDA-authorised area.

news.title: Zoning confusion fuels disputes over PG legality in Bengaluru
news.para: Sanjeevini Nagar residents oppose PG, citing BBMP rules against commercial use on narrow roads; with no clear zoning guidelines, enforcement remains inconsistent across Bengaluru

news.title: Sebi board clears measures to enhance ease of doing business for REITs, InvITs, merchant bankers
news.para: Regarding approved regulatory framework for REITs and InvITs, Sebi said that the related parties of the REIT/InvIT and the related parties of the sponsor, investment manager/manager, and project manager would not be considered as "public" unless such related parties are Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs).

news.title: ED attaches ₹44-crore Delhi house of Bhasin Infotech accused of duping homebuyers
news.para: The money laundering case stems from multiple Uttar Pradesh Police (Noida) FIRs filed in 2015 against Bhasin Infotech and Infrastructure, Grand Venice group entities, Bhasin, Quincy Bhasin and others on charges of cheating, fraud and criminal conspiracy.

news.title: West Bengal government lifts land ceiling barrier for private parties
news.para: Additionally, the lessee or land allottee will have to utilise the land for the specified purpose as mentioned in the lease deed within three years of the execution of the said deed.

news.title: Germany's Pfandbriefbank withdraws guidance as it winds down US business
news.para: PBB said in May that it would not take on new business in the United States as it considered the country too volatile under President Donald Trump.

news.title: Lodha Developers acquires 945 apartments in Mumbai’s Mankhurd for ₹567 crore
news.para: Lodha Developers has acquired 945 apartments in Mankhurd for Rs 567 crore to meet its slum rehabilitation commitments in Vikhroli. This significant SRA-linked asset transfer highlights the growing trend of offsite PTC fulfilment in Mumbai.

news.title: Arisinfra Solutions' IPO gets subscribed 24% on Day 1 of offer
news.para: The Initial Public Offer (IPO) got bids for 31,78,815 shares against 1,30,84,656 shares on offer, as per NSE data. The category for Retail Individual Investors (RIIs) got fully subscribed by 1.04 times. The quota for non-institutional investors received 19 per cent subscription.

news.title: Germany clears bill to expedite housing construction by cutting red tape
news.para: The number of apartments built in Germany dropped sharply last year, falling 14.4% from 2023 to 251,900 - far below the previous government's goal of 400,000 apartments a year - as Germany's property sector recovers tentatively from its most severe slump in decades, which began in 2022.

news.title: Residential building permits up 4.9% in Germany in April
news.para: Federal Statistical Office data showed on Wednesday that 18,500 permits for new apartments and houses were granted in April, up 900 from a year prior. The gain in March was 5.8%, or 1100 permits.

news.title: Odisha to simplify land classifications, ownership types
news.para: The state will bring down the existing 7,000-plus types of land classifications to just 27 categories through legislative amendments. Additionally, the govt aims to slash the current 3,000 different types of land ownership to double digits, the minister said.

news.title: Nagpur civic body unveils new development plan to guide urban growth
news.para: ​​The new DP — being prepared under Sections 23(1), 34, and 38 of the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning (MRTP) Act, 1966 — will replace the earlier plan prepared in 2000 by the Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT) and though revisions are legally required every 20 years, the process was delayed until now.

news.title: Bengaluru: Consumer court orders BDA to refund ₹8 lakh for delay in handing over flat
news.para: On March 21, 2025, the Commission ordered BDA to refund Rs 8.03 lakh, along with an interest of 18% from the date the first payment was made, Rs 1 lakh for service deficiency, Rs 25,000 for mental agony, and another Rs 10,000 in litigation costs.

news.title: Start process to merge villages into Kolhapur civic body's limits: Maharashtra CM to officials
news.para: The discussion centred on the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation's recent proposal to merge 18 adjacent villages and two Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporations (MIDC) into the city limits.

news.title: Surat: 151 apartment residents get notices to vacate for lack of BU certificate
news.para: The multi-storey apartment buildings were not granted BUCs by the SMC due to non-compliance on various grounds, one of which is believed to be height.

news.title: Kerala: KCZMA ‘restriction’ causes concern among residents over property ownership & transfer rights
news.para: According to the pre-condition put forth by KCZMA for giving CRZ-2019 clearance for construction in these zones, the building should not be sold or transferred to non-traditional coastal communities.

news.title: Cabinet clears ₹150-crore plan for six new small airports in Bihar
news.para: The new airports will be developed in Madhubani, Birpur, Munger, Valmikinagar, Muzaffarpur and Saharsa, cabinet secretariat department additional chief secretary S Siddharth said after the cabinet meeting chaired by CM Nitish Kumar.

news.title: A 50% stamp duty concession for land transactions under MMRDA's Pen township project
news.para: The project will be implemented by the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) and Raigad Pen Growth Centre Ltd in Pen taluka.

news.title: Pune civic body pushes to relocate tenants of dilapidated wadas
news.para: Residents of structures found dangerous will be shifted to safer places during the rainy season and Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will make necessary arrangements for the move.
